ConfirmAPIAccess.FormHeading: Who is the API Access for?
ConfirmAPIAccess.Introduction: Please inform us for whom your API access request is for, from the options below:

Thankyou.BodyMultiple:
Your request has been sent to Atradius.

We will email you with details on how to login to the developer portal - this can take up to 4 hours. 

Developer portal login

TermsAndCondtion: I've read and accept the terms and conditions

CompanySearchForm.BodyMultiple:
Use the below fields to search for your organisation. We encourage use of the “Search by identifier” for accuracy.  

Existing Atradius Customers please use the Search by Atradius ID using the Insured Organisation ID in your Policy documents to ensure correct set up.
CompanySearchForm.FormHeading: Search for the organisation Developing the APIs
CompanySearchForm.Introduction: This is the organisation that will Develop the APIs, which may differ to the organisation owning the API Account e.g. Policy Holder

ClientResult.BodyMultiple:
Can't find your organisation?

You can try different search criteria or alternatively please�contact us.
ClientResult.ErrorText:
No results found matching the criteria you entered.

Please refine your search and try again.

Can't find your organisation?

You can try different search criteria or alternatively please contact us.
ClientResult.Introduction: Use the below fields to search for your organisation. Please provide information for either company name and address or company registration, VAT number or identifier type.

Summary.ErrorText:
Unfortunately, there has been a validation error.

The email address you provided is already in use, please use another address or if you wish to speak to Atradius please contact us.

PersonalDetail.BodyMultiple:
If you are new to Atradius APIs and do not have an Atradius User ID, please complete the self-registration below. For all other requests, please click here.

Please provide us with the personal details of the person who will Develop the APIs. These details will be used to create a Developer trial account. Details of the organisation who wants access to the APIs can be provided under “Who is API Access for?” if it differs from the Developer organisation.

CompanySearchResults.Introduction: Please select an organisation from the list below

ClientSearch.BodyMultiple: Please search using either the identifier search or organisation details search.
ClientSearch.Introduction: Use the fields below to search for your client organisation. Please provide information for either company name and address or company registration, VAT number or identifier type.
